website_summaries.verdict: A unique surround kit for a standard 10 gal. tank. This kit becomes the filter for the tank allowing you an interesting entry into aquaponics.
pros: This aquarium set is designed on an aquaponics model
The plants filter the water and the fish waste fertilizes the plants
It can grow herbs or other small plants
Includes a bar for hanging a plant grow light
cons: This beautiful setup is not for beginners
You really need to know your tanks to be successful with this one
It also may require a grow light for the plants

customer_reviews.title: This works great. I have eight neon tetra happily living in ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I have eight neon tetra happily living in the tank and I've got plentiful basil and some wheatgrass growing in the garden. Expect to spend a little time setting up your system. If like me you want to put live plants in the aquarium, it's best to purchase an LED light that is submersible as one with a hood does not work. Once you've got the system set up and the tank cycled, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: MA Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Not like description and tank is not included. Very cheap matrral for the price
customer_reviews.author: amelia hellyer

customer_reviews.title: Too powerful for a 10 gallon, buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this because within a few weeks, it's killed all my fish as the filter is way too powerful and if a fish was anywhere nearby it couldn't escape the current. This includes our algae rather that we've had four 5+ years and was HUGE. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Loeber

customer_reviews.title: Missing components/Many other items to purchase
customer_reviews.text: Hard to follow directions especially since some of the parts were missing. Requires purchase of many other items to make it work. Can't recommend this product. You can set up an aquaponics systems by purchasing the equipment you need on your own - easier, more effective and less costly than making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Debra S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I recommend is going to the web site and watching the videos and blogs before you put it together. The customer service is great and they really want you to be successful with it. I wish it had a built in LED light for the aquarium. I've already got sprouts!!
customer_reviews.author: msmoers

customer_reviews.title: I love how well it circulates the water for my fish ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how well it circulates the water for my fish health. The thing I didn't expect was the noise, however I learned you can put more of the extenders onto the bottom of the grow bed to lessen the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Turr

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro system to Aquaponics
customer_reviews.text: I started with 2 guppies to get the aquarium cycled. Added some plants up top gradually. And now that it’s fully cycled, the plants up top are really taking off. I added some more fish today and am really happy with this set up. It was really loud at first, but after talking to their customer support, I tried their suggestions (add spacers to the bottom, put aquarium tubing through the part where the water comes out). Now I don’t feel it’s not much louder than a normal aquarium filter and it sounds rather pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: rs

customer_reviews.title: Killed my fish
customer_reviews.text: This tank killed my fish, I had it for a little over two weeks, I got it to have a little extra something at home when my husband deployed and so I got two Cory fish, a snail and a Betta fish. The filter sucked my poor beta into it, ripped off his fins and sucked out some of his organs. I found him less than an hour after I fed him. I wish there had been a warning about the filter or something along those lines.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Kampa

customer_reviews.title: Inspiration on top of a fish tank.
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the customer service phenomenal, the product is great too. Now my whole family loves our little project and there’s so much to learn. Our cilantro, kale, lettuce, arugula and buckwheat are growing quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Fun hobby, but get ready for the money pit
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap keeping fish alive is expensive! I have been getting basil to germinate along with coriander on top. We have 4 Cory catfish in the 10gallon tank. It will take 6 - 8 weeks BEFORE you put fish in there. You will kill them like we did otherwise. Do your homework first! But it is pretty cool...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Koehler

customer_reviews.title: For the price, I was expecting a nicer product ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I was expecting a nicer product. The garden stands are black plastic. It does not come with a tank. It doesn’t come with seeds. You’re basically paying for an unsightly plastic stand, clay balls, and a filter that stands out and doesn’t stick to the aquarium. I’ve had this for several months and bought an actual grow light and have only been able to to begin to grow 2 out of 4 plants. The aquarium gets filthy from the clay and requires frequent cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: MegLizP

customer_reviews.title: Great product and awesome customers service
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing system, easy to set up, it's amazing to see my fishes while I've plant over it, beside regular feeding and cleaning, it kinda take care of itself, note that the tank is not provided. Now I had an issue lately and Jackson replied within minutes with a solution that fix my pump, I highly recommend this product if you're into Aquaponics or on the verge.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Herbs
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I haven't gotten fish into it yet, as I am still working on the plants. It is fairly complicated, a little project. Do note, however, this is not just an aquarium for kids. It takes quite a bit of work to set up and maintain. I am excited though for fresh herbs right in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Lou A.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT... BUT
customer_reviews.text: the concept is great, but the price is way to high with there being no "tank" and nothing else noanything... drop the price and add the tank and I would be 1 of the first to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: sherrie mcginty

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have unboxed the Aquasprouts and I'm very excited, but do not yet have my aquarium established. Thank you. Update: I mistook this for being an American Product. FYI: most of the pieces are made in China. I'm happy with the look of this grow bed, but I would be happier if this was Made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Tieguy

customer_reviews.title: Fun Project
customer_reviews.text: I found set up to be rather easy, but you do need to invest time and additional resources to the project. Paying attention to the chemistry is a huge part of it. However, if you stick with it and do a little research it is well worth the time and effort. I love my set up. My plants are starting to grow now and my fish seem happy with their environment.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. It looks very nice and the tank seems to stay clean so much longer... Yay! 😊 it’s definitely some work so be prepared. I wish the tube was clear and not black and that I could clean it better but you need to take the whole thing apart because it fits so snuggly which is good. My next thing is to buy a plant light as my plants are all leaning toward the window and one side is not getting light so not really growing.
customer_reviews.author: NikkiJ

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Plants died. Killed fish. Way to expensive for junky plastic and a pump. The add is misleading. 1- doesn’t come with a fish tank. 2- doesn’t come with any hydroponic light. Just expensive plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: Im actually returning this item because it doesn't come with the tank for the fish. For $150 I was expecting everything in the cover photo (minus the plants and fish of course).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super fun science experiment!
customer_reviews.text: Great for aquaponics! Clay substrate takes some time to get waterlogged, until it does it floats a little every time the water pump turns on.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Miller

customer_reviews.title: I had a lot of trouble with this. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble with this. I finally bought a much smaller pump and made it a continuous-flow system.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great conversation piece
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s amazing! My plants are very healthy and maintaining is very easy. Plants do most of the work in keeping your tank clean. My friends love it every time they come over.
customer_reviews.author: mannieg10

customer_reviews.title: No male Bettas!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great after I switched fish because it sucked my male Betta fish into the pump and killed him, it never occurred to me that his fins could get caught like that and it is very loud but after I figured out how to work with it things have been going great. Word of advice though, don't put anything with long fins in the tank!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Long

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I just could not get the balance of plants and fish. Ended up being more work than it was worth.
customer_reviews.author: James U.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great looking product. You do need to purchase a standard 10 gallon tank to complete the setup. I have to say their customer service is top notch. Always responsive and helpful. I've chatted with them on Facebook, webchat and on the phone several times. Being new to aquaponics it was a great help. If you don't like the splashing from the return water just ask for more risers to attach to the outlet spouts. Looking to purchase a second one once this one gets established.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Food Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love mine very much! now if only they made one for my 50 gallon! 8 stars in my book
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I set this up after Christmas and the water still isn’t right to add fish yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not include all components! Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money!! Very misleading!! Incredibly disappointed. Will never buy anything from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great way to get started on aquaponics
customer_reviews.text: working out great raising Tilapia in it and they are quickly out growing the tank so , i am now so into it a am building another system with a 55 gallon tank , this garden was so simple to set up and get started i have fresh herbs every day from it
customer_reviews.author: DAvid Giusiana

customer_reviews.title: It’s a balancing act ... Keep it simple is the best courses of action
customer_reviews.text: Trying to get a perfect balance with it —- lost my mescaline greens and celery
customer_reviews.author: cafedame

customer_reviews.title: Works great alot of thought in the design to make it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great alot of thought in the design to make it almost failsafe have healthy fish and plants growing happy with this system
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Hazeu

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just remember you still have to buy the 10 gallon tank. Fish love it and minimal cleaning has been required. (We still have to clean the tank, but it’s not overly dirty) would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This will definitely be a "project", but a great beginner intro to Aquaponics
customer_reviews.text: She loved it - will take some work to put it together
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: very cheap. should have just got put one together myself.
customer_reviews.author: Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t fill the water too high
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize that it was for an existing aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Val_D

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Some many issues with this product. I could fix several things on my own that would make this kit ten times better. Not worth 150 bucks!
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: It's cool, but...
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, for the price I cannot believe it doesn't come with the 10 gallon fishtank.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Most liked: convenient one package and self contained
customer_reviews.text: Most liked: convenient one package and self contained. Easy to assemble. Least: hard to get light unit at right height.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had fun setting it with students at our school
customer_reviews.author: Chris WIlson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first system
customer_reviews.text: This is a great system of anyone, it comes with a picture book that couldn't make it easier. I recommend watching videos on how to set it up right or you can have water finding it's way onto the floor. Now I am working on making my own bigger system
customer_reviews.author: Jesse D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my birthday last year and it has done great. Videos are very helpful getting setup. Currently growing lettuce, mint and rosemary. 3 goldfish in a generic 10 gallon tank from the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great and good looking small aquaponics system
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great and good looking small aquaponics system. You can make one of these systems but it's hard to make it look so sleek for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Pump doesn't sufficiently keep tank clean and plants do not grow in the medium. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Johnna J Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this little system. Only had it ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this little system. Only had it running for 3 days now but it has a lot of potential.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: IMPORTANT MISSING PIECE
customer_reviews.text: I am missing the MOST important part of the submersible pump! The nozzle was not in the packaging. Extremely unhappy with this.
customer_reviews.author: claudia fahmi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, I love it. Waiting on my first harvest.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A hall

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a gift. Unfortunately the person couldn’t use ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift. Unfortunately the person couldn’t use it until they had to purchase more. It does NOT come with a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in product. For the price really should include an aquarium. This was just a few pieces of plastic and is 3 times the price of the other kits which do include the aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Maes

customer_reviews.title: I felt this product was misleading. The images show ...
customer_reviews.text: I felt this product was misleading. The images show a tank with a fish. I thought it came with a tank. And yes I can read and it does state it does not come with a tank but for the money I think it should have come with everything. Essentially it is a 150 dollar tiny planter.
customer_reviews.author: Green13

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Where’s the plants? Pictures all show plants and no warning that plants not included!
customer_reviews.author: John Gaisford

product_meta.title: AquaSprouts Garden
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

It's not magic - it's nature! Aquaponics employs the same principles as the natural world. Imagine having a living ecosystem to grow, learn and discover with-all in your own home. The AquaSprouts Garden includes everything you need to turn any standard 10-gallon aquarium ( approximately 20" x 10" x 12") into a self-sustaining ecosystem using the beauty of aquaponics. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




What’s in the box? •AquaSprouts Garden: Comes in a modern and black matte design, which is perfect for accommodating and matching with any decor, and is assembled easily with no tools required.

•Light Bar:A removable light bar to which you can affix any standard indoor grow light of your choice- ideal for places with insufficient natural light sources. You can simply adjust the light according to your plants' necessities. 

•Pump & Timer: The kit includes a submersible 9.5 Watts / 120 V 160 gallons per hour pump. Along with a 24 hour timer that can be set for 15 minute intervals. Both the pump and timer include a 1-year warranty. 

•Grow Media: Our special clay grow media replaces soil from traditional gardening and serves as the support for your plants in the grow-bed. They also provide a surface area for the bacteria to grow and convert the fish waste into nutrients for your plants. The grow media traps fish waste and uneaten fish food-- making the grow-bed a mechanical filter. (Grow media does not degrade) 

•Resources & Support: Each kit comes with a detailed and step-by-step guide to setting up and maintaining your Garden. As well as that, our dedicated support team is just one email or phone call away if you have any questions or need assistance. We also provide live chat on our website. 

Natural Aquarium The Garden’s design is simple, freestanding, and virtually maintenance-free, making indoor gardening and a beautiful aquarium accessible to anyone regardless of experience with fish or plants. It eliminates the need for traditional fertilizers using the same principles that recycle wastes in natural ecosystems, making upkeep as simple as feeding your fish. We built the Garden to fit over any standard 10-gallon aquarium, including existing tanks, making it the perfect way to grow fresh herbs and vegetables or beautiful ornamentals anywhere.




Aquaponics involves breaking down toxic ammonia and turning it into nutritious plant food called nitrates using two types of nitrifying bacteria – nitrosomas and nitrospiras. When fish produce ammonia it attracts a type of bacteria called nitrosomas. 

These guys and gals convert the ammonia into nitrites – a compound even more toxic than ammonia. Thankfully, however, nitrites attract another type of bacteria called nitrospiras who then convert the nitrites into nitrates – excellent food for plants, and mostly harmless to fish.

Once this has happened the aquaponic cycle is complete and, once stabilized, will ensure ammonia levels are kept at a minimum while providing maximum nutrition for the plants. 




Transform Your Aquarium The AquaSprouts Garden is designed to fit any standard 10-gallon aquarium - one of the most common and widely available aquariums - and provides a platform to grow a wide variety of plants. Its sleek, modern design also makes it a great conversation piece for any home’s décor.




About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

Educational, Natural, Beautiful

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

Everyone on our team are makers, thinkers, hobbyists, and learners. We are personally dedicated to promoting aquaponics in a way that’s simple, hands-on, and aesthetic. We want AquaSprouts to be more than just a product; we want to provide a platform for you to explore aquaponics and see how its synthesis of natural science and technology can change the world.

What makes your product special?

We designed the AquaSprouts Garden to bring the revolutionary principles of aquaponic farming into the home, office, and classroom, because we believe aquaponics offers something to benefit everyone. By combining fishkeeping and hydroponic gardening, aquaponics does things that neither can do alone, dramatically reducing waste and maintenance. By circulating the water from your aquarium through the Garden’s bed, the AquaSprouts Garden recycles fish waste to provide vital nutrients for growing plants, leaving the water clean and clear without the need for additional filters or frequent water changes.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

Spreading our passions for aquaponics! Our goal with the AquaSprouts Garden is not to feed you and your neighbors directly, but to feed minds and fuel curiosity. The Garden is a miniaturized, living lesson in sustainability in a world where the concept becomes more important every day. This belief in a better future is one reason we place an emphasis on bringing aquaponics and curriculum kits to classrooms around the globe.
feature_bullets: The AquaSprouts Garden is a self-sustaining aquarium & aquaponics kit for the home, office or school
Fish fertilize the plants. Plants clean the water for the fish. Fits any standard 10-gallon aquarium
Grow a variety of veggies, herbs, greens and decorative plants all year long
Perfect tool to explore how our natural environment works. Specialized teacher curricula available
This updated model includes adjustable drain extenders to quiet water flow

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars153 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
